s.text: I also tried to appear serene--hoping to convey a Buddhist quality.
The class leader, a loan officer named Vince, spent three sessions explaining how none of us would ever, ever own a home.

I had lived there four years and loved the funny hillside street with its old houses populated by fanatical gardeners and Harley enthusiasts.
Forget it.
Forget it.
Forget it.
She phonetically wrote down the familiar chant NAM YOHO REN GAY KYO and said that by chanting it every day I'd manifest my wishes in the fourth dimension.

As we house shopped, we realized we were being punished for our sanctimonious attitudes and for enjoying our easy bus ride to work.
We bid like addicted gamblers, placing opening bids $20,000 over the asking price with a clause to increase our price another $20,000 if necessary.
